Class Hailstone

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hailstone

  • public class Hailstone
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a Hailstone Sequence
    Version:
    9/18/2014
    Author:
    Zachary Green, Truc Ha, Eric Glover

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hailstone

        public Hailstone(int num)
        Constructor for Hailstone objects -- 1 int argument. This constructor takes in one number to be computed into a Hailstone sequence. After being constructed the starting value, the sequence list, and largest value can be printed or returned.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to compute the Hailstone sequence for.

      • Hailstone

        public Hailstone(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Constructor for Hailstone objects -- 1 ArrayList argument. This constructor takes in an ArrayList to be computed into Hailstone sequences. Each number within the array will become its own Hailstone object. Finding the longest sequence and the corresponding starting value and largest value can be printed or returned by the printLongestSequence() and getLongestSequence() methods.
        Parameters:
        list - the ArrayList of numbers to compute the Hailstone sequence for.

      • Hailstone

        public Hailstone(int start,
                 int end)
        Constructor for Hailstone objects -- 2 int arguments. This constructor takes in two int arguments, with start being the starting value and end being the ending value. Each number within the range inclusively will be become its own Hailstone object. Finding the longest sequence and the corresponding starting value and largest value can be printed or returned by the printLongestSequence() and getLongestSequence() methods.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting value of the range to compute the Hailstone sequence for.
        end - the ending value of the range to compute the Hailstone sequence for.

      • getLongestSequence

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getLongestSequence()
        Accessor -- gets the value of the longest sequence from the Sequence Class along with the starting value and the largest value.
        Returns:
        ArrayList -- returns an array of the longest sequence value, starting value and largest value.
